pageContext.claim: “‘FBI Director apologizes for FISA Errors (of which there were far to many to be a coincidence!).’ @FoxNews Chris, what about all of the lives that were ruined because of the so-called 'errors?' Are these 'dirty cops' going to pay a big price for the fraud they committed?”
pageContext.analysis: The Justice Department inspector general found numerous errors in the warrant application for secret surveillance of Carter Page. But the surveillance began after Page had left Trump's campaign and the inspector general found no bias in the FBI's decision-making. The Trump associates who have been convicted were not the victims of an FBI fraud. They either pleaded guilty or were found guilty by a jury.
